revised_title: Reproductive Hazards from Environmental Chemicals: Congenital Malformations and Other Risks
tldr: This article discusses the potential hazards of environmental chemicals on human reproduction, including congenital malformations, abortions, and other adverse effects on offspring. It highlights the importance of monitoring and regulating exposure to chemicals in both the workplace and the general environment to protect reproductive health.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Environmental Toxicology
